text: Bottle. BB 02.02.2018. Very dark brown with big and persistent beige head. Burnt roasty, sweet, some grassy hops. Fairly bitter, in fact. Smooth, soft mouthfeel. Good, but kinda fell short from expectations.
Bottle 330ml (Bar Explosive). Opaque black color, small brownish head. Roasted, burned malty aroma. Medium-bodied. Roasted, chocolaty, a bit burned and hoppy. Robust sipper stout.
Notes from old tasting session. Bottle with friends. Black. Charred wood, licorice, peat. Char. Smooth and excuisite.
Keg @ Friends Of Ham, Leeds. Black with a very thin off-white head. Strong tasting with crisp roasted malts. Has a good aroma too.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 211117, from Alko, 20170609) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had burnt malts, liquorice and mildly sourness. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt malts, dark chocolate, lightly sourness, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was burnt and bitter. A pleasant balanced stout.

Growler fill at Lager Lager, Berlin. Pours with a nontransparent, nearly black color and a nice tan head. Aromas of roasted maltsand coffee. Taste of roasted malt, dark chocolat and coffee, slightly dried apricot and hints of pepper at the end. Nice bitter-dry finish.

Coffee, roasted malts, chocolate and ash in nose. Pours black with tan head. Taste is medium sweet with roasted malts, some caramel, coffee, chocolate, ash. Medium bitter finish, average to soft carbo, average+ body. Overall very good.

Bottle from Waitrose. My first Redchurch and it's pretty good. Slight complexity here. Not too boozy - despite the 7.5% - so easy to drink. Just slightly harsh afters.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Black with a large head and quite lively on opening.Lovely creamy malty flavour. Reasonable body but not overpowering. An all round excellent stout that is hard to fault.

Black colour, creamy tan head. Nice rich, malty aroma with slight roastedness and some amaretto. Rich taste, roasted malts, medium bitterness and a nice, malty finish. Medium body, medium carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Very nice and full flavoured stout.

Color negro con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (retención decente). Carbonatación media. Textura oleosa y untuosa. Aroma torrefacto, con notas de café y cítricos (lúpulo sorprendentemente presente), ligeramente licorosa. En boca entra dulce, con mucha malta torrefacta y reminiscencias de café y cacao puro, los toques cítricos y el lúpulo aparecen rápidamente para redondear un final ligeramente amargo, cítrico y un poco licoroso. Postgusto torrefacto y ligeramente lupulado. Extraña, compleja e hiper rica. De lo mejor en cuanto a Stouts.

1/2 pint on tap @ One Pint Pub. Pours very dark red with a medium creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with some coffee. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and hops. Creamy. Excellent.

Noire à mousse beige et bulles moyennes. Nez : épicé, résineux, café torréfié, houblons donnant du fruité, chocolat noir ... Bouche : fraîche, ronde, crémeuse aux saveurs de chocolat, moka/café, réglisse, prune, herbes et épices avec une moyenne amertume. Belle réalisation super équilibrée.

Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours black with a little white head. The aroma features strong roasty maltiness with pronounced notes of roasty coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is medium roasty and also quite sweet; not really bitter, even in the finish. Flavours are fairly well in balance and rich: chocolate rises above coffee with licorice also appearing. The palate is medium to full bodied, smooth and low in carbonation. Tasty strong stout. On the sweet side but not too much.

>> From Hoppy House  Stout londonien assez classique mais au houblonnage moderne  ::: Beau nez sophistiqué à la fois fruité herbacé et un peu résineux avec beaucoup de levure. Attaque onctueuse quasi lactée grasse caramélisée aux arômes de chocolat amer et lactique. Milieu de bouche plus fruité à la réglisse et aux saveurs de prune et de cassis accompagnée dune sensation granuleuse de cacao et de cendrée; le tout, malheureusement, impactant plus darrière palais. Finale très longue torréfiée aigre douce et chocolatée légèrement surette. Beaucoup déquilibre dans ce stout délicieux. #399

Draught at Rotterdam. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, nuts, hops, chocolate, coffee, licorice and wood. Bitter finish with roasted malts, chocolate, nuts, coffee, wood and licorice. Excellent porter.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black beer with a medium sized, slightly beige head on top. Aroma of coffee and roasted malts, some tarty notes in there, a hint of vanilla and caramel in the back. Flavor is a bit weird, but certainly likeable. Starts off fairly sweet, clean and full, finishes with a slight acidic notes that reminds me of the aftertaste in a porter. Must be some coffee notes or something. Also some darker chocolate in there, more in the middle. Creamy. low carbonated moutfheel and long. light tarty aftertaste. Nice one.
Tap at monterey bar in Berlin. Pours pitch black. Nose is leather, toffee, toast, chocolate. Palate is oily chocolate, coffee, a bit earthy. Good stuff!

Pours a dark brown looking black in the glass. A medium tan top. Strong aroma of coffee along with malts and caramel. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Bitter coffee flavours dominate. Quite nice.

Bottle. Black body with a big, dense, light beige head. Wondelful aroma of roasted malt, pine and fruity hops with some coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is very nice as well and tastes like the aroma  roasted malt, pine, fruity hops, dark chocolate, coffee and pleasant bitterness. Fine balanced body as well and long lasting smooth tasting aftertaste. Very nice.

Tap at Brewdog Helsinki, Helsinki. Colour is almost black with small slightly brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Some coffee, some dark chocolate, dryness, some berries? some ash and roasted malts. I dont like this "berry element" but overall still very good and superb drinkability.
Bottle @ home. Blackish pour with a tan head. Notes of heavy roast, light smoke, ashy, some licorice, light chocolate and a medium bitterness.

Balkc. Malty, bit woody, old pencil-like, and a boozy (old dried sweet) fruityness. Med bodied, dryish finish, incredably easy body. Flavour like an 8 abv, but easy as that last 4.1 I had. Appleaud the effort put into fermenting this thing proper.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle shared with the family in London (12/03/2017) - pours black with a tanned head. Aroma and taste is roasted and sweet malty with notes of coffee and chocolate, caramel, charred burnt malty accents, roasted malty close.

(Tap) Es ist schwarz, undurchsichtig mit einer braunen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist etwas schokoladig, dunkle Beere, vllt. etwas Traube, etwas Holzfass, vllt. Eiche. Der Geschmack ist rund, fängt samtig an und wird dann stark bitter, viel Zartbitterschokolade, auf der Zungenspitze etwas fruchtig und neben der Schokobombe ist etwas Röstaroma erkennbar. Die Karbonisierung ist fast etwas stark. Sehr rund im Geschmack, könnte etwas weniger bitter sein.

Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and roasted malt. Flavor is sweet and malt with some licorice, chocolate, some bitterness and herbs. Medium body, average carbonation.
Tap at Gentle Boozers in Rome-Italy. Black color, creamy brownish foam. Nose: licorice, a bit earthy, roast is soft. Mouth: rich roast, raw notes of coffee. Nice.

The aroma is full of chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, smoke, vanilla and caramel. The color is pitch black and there is no head. The taste is full of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, dark berries, dried fruits, vanilla, smoke, caramel, leather and tar. A nice beer!

Very deep brown colour, close to black, with a mediumsized beigeish brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, some ashes, wood, mild toasted and nutty notes as well. Flavour is roasted malts, ashes, some toffee, mild nutty notes as well as some slight ripe fruits, but not that sweet. Very tasty, and balanced with a quite big palate to it.
Bottle from Boxbeers. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is dark roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, some fruits. Full body. Medium carbonation. Bitter roasted finish. Nice.

appearance: almost black, short creamy head.  aroma: 	chocolate, roast, redeye coffee, chicory.  taste: as the aroma indicates; bittersweet chocolate, plus mint, coffee, umami.  finish: 	dry, smooth, slightly chewy but mostly dry and bittersweet. notes: Very nice. Draft at Owens Ordinary in Rockville, Maryland.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, chocolate, herbs.
Appearance: jetblack and creamy head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, roasted dark malts, coffee, bitter chocolate, ashy, burnt malt, really smooth, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Its a great FES, complex and smooth.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2017 From tap at Honoloeloe Mechelen.Poured really black with a beige thick cream head. Head is brilliant lacing.Aroma has sugary milk, a bit citrus, chocolat, mild sausage, honey.Taste has chocolat, coffee, mocha but something sour fruity as well.Slow bitter finish, full mouthfeel, long lasting.
Bottle from eebira. Almost black colour with a thin tan head. Aroma is chocolate and coffee. Taste roasted bitter malts. Decent thick body.
A dark an enjoyable stout. Dark choclaty and very clean finish. Quite a strong boozy finish.

Surprisingly smooth though spicy stout. Not really heavy, with a bitter Aftertaste. 
Notes of pepper, black chocolate, ripe fruit, Roasted malts. 
Very balanced.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2017 Black colored, medium tan creamy head, decent lasting. Aroma is of dark malt, roasty, quite chocolaty and more than a fair share of floral and earthy hops, bit licorice. Taste is medium sweet malt, chocolate, roasted malt, bit brown sugar and some burnt notes, moderate floral hops, medium bitterness with a roasty finish and aftertaste. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. Superb.
(on tap, Delirium Hoppy Loft, Brussels)
Bottled version leaves somewhat lesser impression but still very fine.

Sampled from a bottle from Prohibition Wines. Dark brown/black with a very dark tan head. Strong flavours of roasted malts, wood ash and vanilla. Very bitter finish after a very sweet start. A strong, heavy beer, lacking in charm, but very tasty.
dark brown colour, moderate sized creamy brown head; aroma of cocoa, soy sauce, herbal notes and heavy roasted nuts; taste is the same; great foreign stout
On tap at csakajo. Black colour small brown head. Nose is roasted, cocoa. Taste is also the same, nice nutty aftetaste. Very nice!

Pours dark with low tanned head
Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, black malts, dark bread, hints of dark fruits
Taste has notes of brown sugar, coffee, chocolate, caramel, dark fruits, roasted malts, hints of tar
Mouthfeel is full bodied, medium bitterness, medium carbonation, medium to high sweetness
Pours black, good Rey head. Smell is bit bitter, some dark malts. Taste is rather sweet, grainy, dark and even burnt malts. Tad bitterness, but less than the scent provides. Dark Chocolate. Very Nice
On draught at IMBC. Chocolate, nut, vanilla wood nose. Flavour is caramel, coffee, chocolate, vanilla. One of my favourites of this festival.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours black woth a beige head. The aroma has some pine hop over chocolate notes. The taste is also quite hoppy. Pine again with light spice before chocolate, coffee and liquorice. Excellent.

Bottle @ blackfriars glasgow
 pours a black colour with thick white head
 aroma is chocolate coffee bitter
 taste is very bitter dry chocolate with long dry bitter finish
 really nice beer a proper strong dry bitter stout and not a milk one
 highly recommended
UPDATED: OCT 8, 2016 Erg veel pittige licht strooiige hop in het begin, beetje soja, beetje drop, Beetje zout in de verder mooie zoet bittere smaak...Dikkig, olieachtig...Lekker

From tap at Borefts 15. Pour pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma has some roast, smoke, chocolate and earthiness. Taste has chocolate, milk chocolate, a bit of roast. Quite smooth and nice. Medium body and carbo.
Bottle. Black color. Aroma: burnt barley and coffee. Taste: velvety, slightly sweet caramel, burnt.

7.5%ABV. Stout.

Poured out black. 40ºSRM.

Nose has coffee, fresh cream, wood smoke with that smoky, sour tang. Nutty. Black bread and pumpernickel very strong on the nose. Inviting and rich.

Mouthfeel is soy. Carbonation is a nice touch. Palate has charcoal, burnt toast, treacle, burnt caramel, French roast. Alcoholic palate.

Finish is alcoholic, syrupy and aggressively charcoal bitter that fades into a bourbon like sweetness.

Black beer with a thick brown head. Bitter, malty smell with a splash of citrus, and theres a sharp citrus kick in the taste as well. Thats on top of an otherwise relatively standard stout flavour: bitter malt, some dark chocolate, a touch of burnt toffee.Complex, balanced nicely and very drinkable.

Bottle, batch 422, BB 20.07.16. Pours dark brown-black with beige-brownish head. Aroma is sweet, medicinal, spices, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, dryness, coffee, malt, acidic notes. Finish is roast bitter. Overall: ok.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 Pours deep black with medium brown head. Nose is toffee. Aromas roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and toffee, with creamy notes. Low carbonation, full body. Medium roasty finish. Great foreign stout, full of flavors.
Drank with Thierry at his place during WIDM talks 09-05-2016. Nice beer. Very compelling taste, lots of flavor. Complex.

This is one great stout! Smells like a mix of flowers and licorice, with a nice roasty character. Its quite bitter and feels creamy and full in the mouth. Head was not very present. As far as colour is concerned, this beer is as black as the night. I even held a very strong light up to it from the other side, and not a single photon penetrated through. Overall an excellent stout.

Black color with creamy light brown head. Aroma is really hop forward with some nice roasty undertones and a touch of caramel. If I had this blind, I would have said its a black IPA for sure. Taste starts quite roasty up-front, bitter and slightly acidic with a slight malt sweetness in the background. Hops are still present with bitter and earthy notes but stay more in the back, letting the roasted malts shine. Medium body with a really soft mouthfeel. Overall this is a bitter stout with lots of hops and roasted malts, really tasty and easy drinking.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours almost black, oily, dark brown head. Nose is heavyish roast, chocolate, light liquorice. Full body, tastes roasted malts, salted liquorice, bitter chocolate. Full body and taste but still misses something, maybe some more sweetness to balance the salty roastiness.

Tap @ Brewdog Soho. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. The taste is nice and roasted and with flavours of roasted malts, coffee, dark bitter chocolate, hops and a bit of licorice. Very full body for a 7.5% beer. Soft carbonation. VERY tasty. :-)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 Pours black with a large frothy tan head. Roasted malt, citrus and pine hoppy aroma. Roasted malt, bitter chocolate, zesty orange taste. Some sweetness with a long lingering spicy pine finish.

Tastes like a black IPA -- very bitter, sort of ashy taste. While I sometimes do enjoy intense flavours in beer, this one seemed to distract from the good qualities of the beer. Not my really my cup of tea. Ive only tried one other in this style so far, The Kernel 1890, which was much more what I would expect/hope for beers in this style to taste like.

0,33l bottle at home bought at Firmabier. BB 30.07.2016. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells a bit sourish, rather hoppy, some herbs, exotic fruits, mango, some licorice, earthy. decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes weird sourish, some licorice, green apples, rather unclean / bit pukeish, some hops, herbs, exotic fruits, spices. finishes weird sourish again with some spices and some hop notes. looks like there was an issue with my bottle, not enjoyable.
0,33l fles gedeeld met emile zwart met een bruine kraag. Geur en smaak diep geroosterd, alcohol is wel aanwezig. Afdronk met drop en salmiak, laurier goed maar niet perfect
Black with medium light brown head. Roasted grain aroma with sour note. Strong roasted grain and hops bitterness, some chocolate notes. Bitter aftertaste.
Roast and some mash malt. A little booze. Dark mahogany pour. Light tangy finish. A hint of coffee. Tap at churchkey, last of keg.
Draft at Churchkey. Opaque black color, brown head. Aroma of fruity brownies. Taste is earthy chocolate, dry finish. Nice.

Quite intense roast, wild dried fruits, some coffee, dark choco, licorice, kinda ashy, grassy hops. Mostly sweet with moderate bitterness. Nice, but somethng didnt work well in balance for me, tho its very smooth and overall pleasant
Lots of fruit on the nose, plenty of heavy roast, coffee. Bitter finish. Really tasty, fruity export stout. Nice.
light old burnt aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, light old burnt finish.

Draught @ Whats Brewing - Saturday Session 2, Stavanger
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and coffee. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long chocolate, caramel and coffee finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Pours dark black with a yellow persistent head, lacing and soft carbonation.

Aroma is chocolate, liquorice, vanilla, molasses, dark fruit, but plenty of hops from the pine and spice Columbus which is a good match for the malts. Finish is boozy, silky and long, smooth with lots of body, yet its not harsh with ash as some stouts can be.

Very decent imperial stout. Packs a lot in yet still has balance.

Black, brown thick and lasting head. 
Clove, pepper, coffee, fruity, 
Bitter, fruity, coffee. 
Quite a complex stout. Very good.

(Thx!) 330 ml. bottle sampled @ 2de Bierproeffestival van De Dijleschuimers. Black, mocha head. Nose is thick mocha, roasted, faint licorice, powdery mocha, reasonable amount of grapefruit & pine hops in the nose, roasted coffee. Taste is pine resin, light syrup, strongly roasted coffee, mocha powder, caramel, some charcoal,.. Tad fizzy & powdery. Nice powdery & hoppy stout.
Dark brown with a tan head. Taste is charcoal and coffee. Charred coffee bean aroma.

Bottle at home. Deep dark brown to black color with a big creamy light brown head. Roasted and hoppy aroma of pine, grapefruit, coffee, sweet biscuits, dark chocolate and some diacetyl. The flavor has also a fruity touch with orange and grapefruit along with coffee, ash and milk chocolate. Has a slick and silky mouth feel, medium body, and a medium bitterness. A surprisingly hoppy stout, and is not far from a BIPA. Tasteful and aromatic. A bit disappointing with the diacetyl but in total a solid stout.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Norway, on order.
Pitch black color, plenty ( maybe a little too much) brownish foam. Medium/high aroma intensity;roasted, leather, licorice, malt and vanilla. Full body & high complexity. Good bitterness and balance. Very enjoyable
Bottle. Almost black. Malt, a hint of roast and berries in the aroma. Malty raisinny, soft roasty flavor with a hint of red berries. Sweetish, characterful stout with soft tart notes.

Smooth malty beer. Round and fresh. Nice floral hops with malty smooth malty body. Round but not too deep. Fresh but not too deep in the body. Round and smooth. Hops with hints like ice-candy (mint). Malty-chocolate aftertaste. Round and nice.

Another generously hopped dark ale from Redchurch that could have been listed as a BIPA, IMHO. It pours a black body with a quite large, creamy, dense, fully lasting, brown head that sticks excellently to the glass. Hoppy, malty, fruity and strong aroma of roasted malt, coffee, tropical fruits and citrus, and some chocolate in the back. Strong flavour of roasted malt, including coffee and chocolate, BIPA-amounts of tropical fruits and grapefruits. Pine needles and liquorice in the back, and hints of black currants. Light to moderate sweet taste with a moderate bitter long-lasting finish. Delicious mouthfeel, its full-bodied and has a creamy and smooth texture with a soft carbonation. Wonderful brew! 
[33 cl bottle, batch 422, enjoyed 9 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Bottle shared with OE at OSB 28.10.15. Ebony. Brown head and lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and star anise, fresh wood, pine and vanilla.
Black with thick head. Aroma is very hoppy, green, piney. Smooth texture. Feels quite boozy. Hoppy, bitter, powerful. Good but just a bit too hoppy to be great.

Bottle 330 ml Appearance: Almost totally black with a 1 finger thick, beige head. Heas has a good retention.
Aroma:, dark chocolate, light roasted malts, vanilla, earthy tones some alcohol (while its only 7.5% abv )
Taste: chocolate bitterness, some roasted vanilla some alcohol. Moderate not too sweet. Finish has a bit of fruityness, before earthy tones and coal kick in. Medium full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture

Bottle, pours black with a beige head. Aroma: liquorice, nuts, espresso. Taste: espresso, cocoa powder, molasses, hazelnuts, liquorice, grass. Moderate high sweetness and moderate bitter, creamy texture, medium body, soft carbonation. Lingering, fairly dry, somewhat warming bitter espresso and chocolate finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Bottle. Fucking gusher, juice all over the place... Opaque, very dark bown with small, creamy, light tan head. Roasted aroma, coffee, hints of licorice and nuts. Similar flavour with the licorice a little more pronounced. Good, lasting, hoppy bitterness to balance the medium sweetness. Creamy mouthfeel, slightly sticky. Nice.

Bottle. Pours thick dark brown with huge tan head, lots of big chunks in there. Aroma is liquorice and hop forward, dark roast, coffee, citric espresso. Taste is liquorice, dry liquorice, hops, grass, citrusy, coffee beans, dark bitter chocolate. Very smooth, low carbonation and hoppy bitter and roasty long finish.

This was the winner from these dudes at BBF. Pours black with small khaki head. Aroma and flavor are very pleasant with roasted grain/malt, milk chocolate, licorice, and hazelnuts. Body was medium to full with average carbonation. Nice

Aroma of licorice, chocolate, hops, coffee, orange peel and wood. Black with a tan head. Medium + sweet and medium + bitter. Full body with a soft carbonation. Dry and bitter finish. Overall a really enjoyable Foregin Stout, quite hoppy.

user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: On tap at Borefts 15. Black body with light brown head. Aroma is roasted coffee, black barley. Taste is bitter with roasted notes, coffee, some dark chocolate. Medium body with low to medium carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 @Borefts 2015, van tap, schenkt zwart met kleine fijne bruine kraag. aroma van salmiak, geroosterde mout, chocolade, koffie, hop. smaken van gebrande en geroosterde mouten, salmiak, chocolade, lichte koffie, niet al te zoet, medium body, gewoon goed.
Thuis nog eens gedronken...net wat beter bevonden...
Dark brown and almost clear. Has a light-brown head, lasting. Roased aroma with notes of fruits and coffee.
Wow, this might be the best beer I have had at Borefts 2015. Some laurel, liquorice too and the usual stout things, but an excellent beer,
Schwarze Farbe, mittelgroße beige Schaumkrone. Geruch schokoladig, viel Kaffee, hopfig bitter. Geschmack sehr hopfig bitter, Karamell, Kaffee, lecker.
Rund schokoladig malziger Antrunk. Leicht herb, steigend schokoladig, vollmundig. 12/12/12/12//13
On tap at Borefts. Black with tan head. Great aromal. Nutty, roasty. Not cocoa. Something foresty---evergreen? Medium body. Very lively. Bitter finsih. Excellent.
Bottle. Black colour with large creamy light brown mostly lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt. Sweet spicy flavor. Creamy palate.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate malty nand hoppy aroma. Strong chocolate notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.

On tap, 1dl tasting glass @ Borefts 2015, Bodegraven. Body is pitch black, head is very small, creamy, brownish, average lasting, good lacing. Nose is mild coffee, flavor is coffee, dark chocolate. Light sweet, heavy roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting dark chocolate, roasted heavy bitter, alcohol is totally hidden. Full body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Quite easy dessert beer, very tasty, great one.
@Borefts2015. Mooie zwarte stout. Aromas van mout, chocola, koffie. Dit komt ook in de smaak terug. Licht rokerig. Mooie volle smaak. Topper!
Tap @ Borefts 15. Blacl colour, small beige head. Smells black ipa, roasty, hops, coffee, nice. Tastes roasty, liquorice, coffee, nice. Full body, nice carbo, nice.

bottle shared at van moll. poured a dark brown to black colour with a big mocha coloured head. nose is earthy hops, bakers chocolate, espresso and burned caramel. licorice, espresso, and a hint of oily pines. bit of a weak mouthfeel. ok
Black with tan head. Chocolate, earth and roast. Sweet, floral, earthy and dry finish. Overall: Nice. Good body.

Bottle. Pours deep opaque black with a large, staying creamy beige head. Aroma has roasted malts, chocolate, vinious, walnuts, coffee. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good solid maltiness, chocolate, coffee, vinious, walnuts. Lovely, lingering malty bitterness.

16.08.2015, tap @ Brewpub le Sec, Barcelona:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, licorice, dark malts, coffee, hops, dark sugar, pine needles. Taste is slightly sour-ish dry, licorice, hops, pine needles, dark malts, sour coffee, grass, bark. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Draught at redchurch. Black colour. Roasted malt, chocolate aroma and flavour, decent stout
From tap at Fermentoren. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, chocolate, spice and bitterness.
Pours brown with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, coffee, grass, orange, flavor of chocolate, coffee, grass, orange, bitter, medium bodied.

(Redchurch Old Ford Export Stout) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a shaker.
Almost totally black colour on the body, one finger of thick, beige head on top, with good retention.
Nice aroma, dark chocolate, light roasted malts, vanilla, some alcohol that here suits fine.
Great taste, again dark chocolate, vanilla, some alcohol, roasted malts, fruity touches on the finish, coal.
Medium thick body, soft carbonation, creamy and smooth on the palate.
Fantastic beer, especially if taken into account the relatively low ABV.

Draught  Small, fast gone yellow-beige head over nearly black beer. Very roasted, Rostbraten, also toasted malts. Coffee, roasted to burnt notes, ashes; and a long lasting dry bitterness. Little or no sourishness for a stout. Medium bodied, long lasting roasted flavours flowing out. Good one.

Draft @ Uiltje. Black pour. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and mild smoke. Taste is very bitter, with roasted coffee and lots of passion fruit hopping, some peach as well. Very balanced and smooth, bit like a black IPA. Great beer.
Tap at t Uiltje, Haarlem: Opaque black colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and liquorice.

Aroma: chocolate, toasted malts, sweet, dark fruits, sugary, turkish coffee. Appearance: black, massive, creamy, beige head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: coffee again, dry sweets, some bitters coming up, toasted malts, charcoal, very dry finish. Overall: excellent Foreign Stout, fantastic aroma, palate not quite as good. Bottle from Twenty One Wines, Brighton.

Bottle. Pitch black, beige head, very big (overcarbonation). Aroma of black malts, chocolate, licorice, low level of smoke adn piney hops. In taste roasty with solid piney flavour, just fantastic. Medium body, oily and smooth on the palate, slightly too high carbonation. In the finish medium bitter, long with low level of acidity. Great stout.

0.33 bottle. Black color and a medium, brownish head. Aroma of malts, chocolate, raisins, delicate licorice, and a touch of smoke. Taste is also malty, sweet, heavy, full of raisins, definite licorice, and hints of cocoa. Full body, thick texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is long, fruity, obviously malty, there is some tobacco and licorice as well. Overall a marvelous beer; bought at a street food market in London for some 3 pounds - did not expect that much.

On tap @ Uiltje bar, Haarlem. Black with a beige head. Aroma of hops, licorice, roasted malts, hint of chocolate. Taste is hoppy bitter, hints of roasted malts, licorice and chocolate, dry hoppy ending, hoppy bitter aftertaste. More a black ipa than stout.

330 ml bottle from Ales by Mail.
Black body, with a medium, creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, smoke, tobacco, toast, bread.
Tastes of chocolate, cocoa, smoke, tobacco, coffee, liquorice, subtle citric hops.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with just enough carbonation for some freshness.
Finishes roasty, smokey, quite dry, with coffee, cocoa, tobacco, liquorice.

Tasty. Really well balanced, roasty and smokey, but also with sweet malts and even some fruity hops. Alcohol is well hidden. Overall a very enjoyable Stout, strong enough, but smooth to drink.
Bottle. Pour is black with a frothy caramel head, aroma is toffee, malty, sweet, caramel. Taste is the same, plus warming alcohol notes and a light bitter finish. Delicious

330 ml bottle drank at Birra+. Gusher altert! Dark brown, murky and hazy looking, with a big, creamy and persistent beige head. Tons of yeasty floaties everywhere. Didnt take proper notes but this is what I remember: on the nose powerful espresso and bitter dark chocolate notes, quite meaty and almost smokey, but way different than many other Stouts. More unique Id say. Taste follow suite, until the aftertaste. There its a resiny and piney hoppy taste that dominates. Ill try to revisit it because the potential is huge, but this particular bottle may not be the best representation of this beer.

beige head leaves structured lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is hoppy, citrus, resin, roasted malts. taste like aroma, liquorice, ash, citrus, slight salty. quite dense mouthfeel, medium carbonation. bottle @ ACBF 15
Dark brown body with a thick brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, but with a nice kick of hops and pine. Taste is sweet with a bitter finish. Full body, thick texture, long bitter finish.

Draft @ Bree Louise, Euston NW1. Pours a dark brown black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty caramel and licorice aroma. Roasted malty licorice and caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty licorice and caramel finish.

Bottle from Kris Wines, London. Pours an onyx black body with a huge creamy beige head. Nose is leather, licorice, brown sugar, grains, deep malty notes and hints of coffee and dark syrup. Taste is deep malts, grains, dark syrup, pine, grass and hints of leather, licorice and dark chocolate. Full body, medium carbonation. Highly pleasant affair. The balanced roastiness combined with liberal, but still somehow restricted hops create a nice and enjoyable sipper. Seems stronger than it actually is, which isnt a bonus, but still a very nice beer.

Drank this one at the Alvinne Craft Beer festival 2015. Bready, smooth, roasty and full bodied.

Draught @ Taphouse. Pitch black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, licorice and a little spruce. Flavour is sweet licorice and malts with a woody touch in the rather dry finish.has a mellow bitterness as well. Very delicious beer.

Black colour, beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel, coffee, cacao. Sweet malty flavour, chocolate, cacao. Quite full body. Finish lingering chocolate. Nice!(from draught @ the brewery, RBESG 2014 Bermondsey tour)

At ACBF. Medium big new generation export stout with deep beige, creamy, stable head and black colour; liquorice, roasted, espresso-like bitterness, subdued candied sweetishness in the onset, smooth dark maltiness, bitter chocolate with lots of coffeeish roastedness in the end paired with a leafy and earthy hop bitterness. Pitch black, 1 finger creamy coffee colored head. Walnut and cedar with a great coffee presence. Rich aromas. Creamy dense mouthfeel which is impressive for this ABV. some old bakers chocolate, very little sweetness and the roasted taste lasts for a while. Very nice
A good roasted and chocolaty taste, with a bit of a bite the first nip, but a nice surprise.

Sampled at ACBF 2015. Very solid stout with distinct hoppy character. Medium thick and easy to drink. Good coffee and black chocolate flavors. Delicious aftertaste leaving a very mild black chocolate feeling.

Keg at The Rake, London. It pours a dark brown/black color with a medium beige head. Aroma is roasty and chocolatey, woody and piney, with slilght tangy berries. Taste is mediums weet and medium dry and roasty, with notes, of chocolate, esporesso, licorice, wood, pine, citrus and red tart berries in the finish. Medium to full bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, very good stout
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is roasted, chocolate, light smoke, taste is similar, dry.

Bottle at the RBWG hotel bottle share 
Black with a medium sized tan head, good lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate and pine. Flavors of roasted malts and chocolate 
Nice

bottle from kihoskh. pitch dark, smooth brown head. aromatic roasted malty aroma with notes of dark fruits, sourness perhaps from wood, faint salt, very complex, really good complex aroma for a 7.5%er. also more subtle notes of licorice, fruits, coffee perhaps. flavor is roasted malts, bitter roasted malts, very smooth and very balanced flavor, some woody notes, bitterness seems to be from loads of malts, boy, this is a great stout. likely the best ever english ive tasted. i have a cold right now, and this beer really does not deserve that...
Tap Dark Brown colour with small head.Aroma is mild spicey and bready with note of caramel and chocolate mild and roasted with smooth mouth feels and good hint of burnt caramel and hops.
Bottle during the RBWG lobby share. Pours a black with beige head. The aroma is roast and chocolate. Similar flavor as nose with light booze, very good.

Bottle taste during RBWG. Brown color. Thin off-white head. Dots and bits of lace. Nice kind of piney earthy fruity hop aroma. Light herbal and minty. Moderate to bigger bitter taste, lighter sweet. Medium body. Smooth, kind of crisp lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Solid export. Nice hop to it.

Draught at Taphouse.
Black colored with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of hops and caramel with notes of grass.
Roasted and hoppy flavor of grass.
Hoppy and roasted finish.

Draft. A black beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, smoke, ash, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of ash, roasted malt, smoke, and dark chocolate, leading to a bitter finish.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a lot of sediment and a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, pine, chocolate, coffee, and grapefruit - with a slightly bitter finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG. Black with tan head. Mild coffee and burn caramel aroma, rich and bitter, malty and a little roasted taste. Full body, long, burnt finish.
On tap at the brewery. Dark brown with a creamy little head. Chocolate and roasted coffee. Full-bodied, malty sweetness,well-balanced. Nice.

Piwo nalewa się z intensywną, brązową trwałą pianą. Aromat zniewala już po otwarciu butelki, a przed każdym łykiem, aż się chce zaciągać, żeby cały czas był z nami. W pierwszej chwili mamy mocną, mleczną czekoladę, która miesza się z igliwiem i żywicą. W tle pojawiają się nuty palone. Mega intrygujący zapach. W smaku piwo jest pełne i początkowo lekko słodkie, z wyraźną czekoladą i popiołowością. Żywiczna goryczka stopniowo rozwija się do poziomu średnio-wysokiego, gdzieś tam pod koniec pojawiają się posmaki kojarzące się z igliwiem. Po ogrzaniu lekko daje o sobie znać alkohol, ale jest przyjemny w odbiorze i fajnie wkomponowany w czekoladowy charakter piwa.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Nir A. for this bottle! Black with a nice tan head. Roasty aroma with nice piney and citric hoppiness and some coffee. Roasty flavor, slightly sweetish, with coffee and a nice citric and piney hops bitterness. Medium-bodied, quite rounded and smooth. Really nice stuff.
Treacle. Liquorice. Coffee. Chocolate. Bitter. One hell of a stout. Incredible
smells malty to the point of vinegary, pitch black with tan lacing, very rich coffee with a strong coffe through into the finish.

Bottle at home. High creamy and lasting brown head. Very dark red brown body. Tart straw coffee liquorice aroma. Dry powerful liquorice coffee flavor with hints of lemon. Good deal of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long dry and bitter finish. Alcohol well hidden. Nicely balanced.

Bottle from the wine seller, Compton, Wolverhampton. Black beer with medium head and wisps of lacing. Aroma of roast malts, a hint of chocolate and hoppy grapefruit. Taste is roasted malts, grapefruit, some ash, dark chocolate and a little dark fruit and licorice. Medium to full bodied. Excellent beer, the second one tonight that I have been waiting to try for a couple of years now.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Earthy grassy spicy herbal aroma with coffee and liquorice roasted notes. Its half an IPA half a stout. Velvety and sticky texture, heavy bodied. Good balance between the malt sweetness and the bitterness given by the hops (english hops I guess) and by the roasted malt. The finish is very long lasting and so so good, a kind of endless battle between the hops fizzy freshness and the warm embrace of the malts and the alcohol. Unottima birra. Sarei molto curioso di assaggiarla alla spina.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a Snifter. Pitch black with a thin, tanned head. Roasted aroma with coffee, liquorice, hard roasted malts, a berry-like fruitiness, herbal hops and pines. Dark, bitter chocolate. Taste is bitter. Full body with an oily texture and a soft, fine carbonation. Lasting, dry and bitter finish with ashes, hard roasted malts and liquorice. Excellent Stout.

Massive roasted aroma. Good dark appearance. Massive punchy taste. Hits you hard. As does the alcohol content.

330ml bottle @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Pours murky black with cappuccino foam. Aroma is pungent, liquorice, mocha and bitter chocolate, traces of hops. Flavour is bitter chocolate and liquorice, coffee, some astringency, a bit filling. Medium body, low carbonation. I expected more from it.

Incredible stout! A very malty, yet fruity aroma. I mean a lot of hops here! Color is pitch black with beige head with tiny bubbles that last a couple of minutes. Taste is very near perfection. The balance between the crazy amount of hops and the smoky malts is great. A true delight. The palate is also top-notch. Very fresh and not at all stuffy. One of the best beers Ive ever drank.

Bottle courtesy of Leighton at Maxs. Pours a deep rich brown body with thin light tan lacing. Aroma is rich earthy roast, tobacco and bitter dark chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium to full with notes of rich earthy coffee, light ash, sweet chocolate, bitter cocoa, tobacco and wood.

21/XI/14 - on tap @ Redchurch Brewery (London) - BB: n/a (2014-1383) 
Very dark brown to black beer, irregular beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: fruity and exotic, sweet, caramel, mocha, soft roast. Mf: soft carbon, medium to full body, smooth texture. Taste: roasted, coffee, bit sweet, some caramel, sourish touch. Aftertaste: pretty hoppy, bitter, coffee grit, malty touch, coffee again, sourish note. Solid stuff.

Barwa i piana: czarna, nieprzejrzysta barwa, trudno orzec o klarowności. Piana jasno brązowa, kremowa, obfita i trwała. 

Aromat: palony, tostowy, kawowy, czekoladowy z cytrusowo - korzenną nutą chmielową oraz alkoholową. Zgrabne połączenie 

Smak: słodowy, raczej słodki z wyraźnymi akcentami czekolady (mlecznej i gorzkiej), kawy, melanoidynów i paloności. Do tego wyraźna chmielowość (owoce), z wyraźnie wyczuwalną goryczką oraz nutą alkoholową. Balans jednak po stronie słodowej. 

Goryczka i odczucie w ustach: dość wysoka goryczka (słodowo- chmielowo-alkoholowa), jednak raczej delikatna bowiem zbalansowana słodową podbudową i z raczej krótkim finiszem. Krągła pełnia, aksamitne odczucie, względnie duże wysycenie. 

Świetne piwo, choć ze względu na obecność amerykańskiego chmielu Columbus nie jest klasyczny FES. Barwa i piana świetne, aromat także interesujący, mimo, że nie klasyczny. Smak także spełnia wszystkie wymogi stylu, zatem nie pozostaje nic innego, jak zachęcić do degustacji. Z perspektywy czasu jestem bowiem zły na siedmiu, że tak długo czekałem. Być może wpłynęła na to dosyć skromna etykieta, jednak piwo naprawdę jest warte swojej oceny.

(bottle) with msbernac; clear very dark brown colour with a medium tall brown head; aroma of citrus, stewed fruit, dried fruit; balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish; slightly creamy palate

Una export stout densa e cremosa, con un corpo sostenuto da note tostate, con un intenso carattere di caffé che dilaga sul palato. Buona buona!

330ml bottle, sourced from Bottledog, London. Pours thick black with a thin beige head, leaving lots of lacing. Aromas of chocolate, smoke, and coffee. Taste is really good, you can really taste the malts, tastes almost oaky. Really original stout. Well worth a drink.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cervezorama 2.0. Color marron. Sabor a malta tostada, dulce, resinoso, ligeramente a regaliz, cafe, amargo.

Bottle(RBESG 2014):Literally black, stable mid-sized tanned head; sweet toasted to roasted malt in the nose, some dried fruits, as well; solid bitter and sweet flavour, pretty full bodied; lingering fruity and toasty finish. Really good
Bottle from Archive Beer Boutique August 2013. Long bitter finish and deep black colour make this beer a winner. Full in the mouth.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours a jet black with a luscious fudge head that stays. Excellent lacing. Aromas of fudgy tablet, marmite and treacle. Beautifully complex flavour with chocolate malts and treacle at first which blend out to a more sweet fudge followed by an almost old bonfire smokey finish. Beautiful!

How: Draught.
Where: At the brewery.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Coffee, malt, caramel, dried fruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Coffee, sweet malt, fruit, caramel, raisin.

Bottle from Deliciouslydifferent. Black colour, creamy light brown foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Also some caramel and brown sugar sweetness. Bitter and sweet. Very well balanced stout. Good!

(keg) black-coloured with a creamy dark beige head. aroma of toasted malts, burnt peanuts and light liquorice, with some earth and a hint of brown sugar. flavour is mostly toasted malts and dark chocolate, with quite a bit of alcohol, some hazelnuts and lots of popcorn in the finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.
Draft - Dark roast and some coffee with chocolate sweetness. Jet black with a brown head. Toasted malts, some roast, cocoa and a bittersweet chocolate finish.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2014 Keg at the Brewery. Incredibly dark brown. Almost opaque. Aroma of chocolate malt, pine resin, a bit of alcohol astringency. Out of this world taste: sweet and creamy underlaid with hoppy bitterness. The bitterness stays in the aftertaste, along with some meaty umami. The alcohol stays with you throughout. Good, good, good.
Pours jet black with good tan head. Nose is roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Some red fruit. More roasted bitterness in the taste, and dark sugar sweetness.

Dobre palone intensywnie palone, naprawde powala. Tostowy pieczony chleb, prazona kawa i nieco gozkiej czekolady, Piana brazowa, gesta obfita i bardzo trwala. Kolor gleboki czarno brazowy, metny i niepszepuszczajacy swiatla. Klasa i swietnie odwzorowany styl irlandzki. Polecam

330ml bottle (Omerta, Krakow)
Nice rich roasty aroma, a touch burnt. Lovely burnt roast in the taste. Full palate, flavour-wise, but the carbonations a bit aggressive, and this needs a few swirls to civilise. Massive aromatic hops in the retronasals. A super hoppy stout. Doesnt taste boozy, but its clearly a big beer. A big tasty beer!
Luxurious chocolate heavy stout, bitter finish, with a mouthful of flavour. Very good
Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours Black with a tan head. A delicious ashen beer with a touch of raisiny sweetness and a bit of burnt toast bitterness. Very nice.

Big frothy light brown head that lasts, dark opaque beer, smooth, tasty, very drinkable, medium body, low bitterness, bottle at bottle shop. Coffee

330 ml. bottle. It pours a very dark brown color with a tall tan head. The aroma is a very rich balance of dark fruit, coffee, cocoa, hints of anise and pumpernickel bread. The flavor is very special with lots of raisin, prune, plum up front followed by dark roast and a little cocoa. The finish is very burnt and roasted with more of the dark fruity accents as well. Extremely tasty and easy to drink. This is a great stout.
On tap. Near black with tan head. Aroma is thick, sweet, coffee and some grassy hop notes. Taste is thick and sweet; chocolate and coffee with some ashy notes. Nice!

Keg at Redchurch Brewery, Bethnall Green, London on the Hickster Bimble. Black with tan head. Bitter coffee notes to the fore, dark chocolate roasted malts, liquorice but smooth at the same time. Good stuff.

On tap at brewery on London Bimble Hickster Invasion day (27/04/14). Pours a very dark brown, black with a tan head. Nice coffee, slightly grassy aroma. Medium body, medium carbonation. Dark chic, coffee, a little lemon... Nice balance. Good.
From a 330ml bottle. Pours black with a lasting thick tan head, deep rich roasted aroma, thick and viscous. Coffee and chocolate flavours, give it a go.....now!
At BBF. Black colour with beige head. Hoppy, grass and roasted aroma. Roasted, chocolate, hoppy and grass taste. Medium body.

330ml bottle. Black with large brown head. Aroma of blackcurrant fruit and surprising amount of citrussy hops. Roasted malt beneath. Taste follows the exact same path. Roasty base swimming in hop fruitiness, again quite unexpected. The hops curtail much of the sweetness but then Id rather have a stout like this be sweeter and less hop-driven.

Bottled. Pours pitch black with an average, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, citrus and licorice. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. An excellent, hoppy stout.

What a fantastic stout! Roasted malt and coffee but with some fruity hops and bitterness. Brilliantly balanced. Very dark in colour with a frothy tan head which lingers and a nice thick feel in the mouth. Top notch!

Tap at Port Street Beer House, Manchester. Nearly black. Thick, lasting tan head. Thick, coffee and cocoa dark maltiness. Some soy. Light, currant fruit, not unlike Vimto cordial. Taste is light, burnt dry. Light bitterness. More Vimto fruitiness on the finish. Took me by surprise, this one. Best beer from a longish session in PSBH.

Keg @ Jolly Butchers, Stoke Newington. Pours beautifully dark with a nice tan head. Has a wonderfully complete taste, chewy almost, presenting a rich, moderately sweet blend with a bitter finish and light coffee airiness on the palette. Brilliant stuff from Redchurch. Relished every drop.

Bottle from Ales By Mail. Pours black with a huge frothy tanned head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee, lots of fruity hops. Smooth light sweet mouthfeel. Taste is rich roasted malts, liquorice and coffee, citrussy hops and peachy sweetness. Lingering dry fruity, nice liquorice.

Bottle at worldbeertastes temporary leaving The Hague tasting. Poured a dark mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is roasted malt, creamy caramel, ripe fruit, light chocolate. Black with a nice tan frothy, lacy, lasting head. Nice full smell of chocolate, smooth nice roast, and caramel. Medium to full oily body. Tastes of nice sweet chocolate with soft roast and a liquorish hop slightly fruity finish. Nice overall bit the finish is rather bitter.
Bottle shared at tasting. Pours dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is lots of chocolate, licorice, caramel and some hops. Taste is pretty bitter and quite sweet. Full bodied and quite thick.

Bottle shared. Pours near black with a thick beige head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruit, licorice and caramel. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long bitter finish. Thick chewy mouthfeel. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Thick creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Lovely bitterness. Lots of chocolate. Lovely

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with medium light tan head. Aroma of coffee, licorice, red berries, dried fruit, toast and light ash. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee, chocolate, licorice, red berries and dried fruit. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty good.
Botella. Xocolata a la boca, cacao al nas, tocs de cafè i amargor floral al paladar. Lleugrra acidesa que tomple la gola. Stout equilibrada i suau. Ideal.

color negro con reflejos caobas y espuma beige densa y persistente. Aromas de café, tostados y un ligero dulzor de frutos rojos. El inicio en la boca es dulce aunque en seguida pasa a un amargor intenso, resinoso, tostado y acafetado que se extiende hasta el regusto. Muy rica.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Black with a big and lasting brown head and a bit of yeast floating. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, licorice and rather hoppy - pine and citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. This is more Black IPA than Foreign Stout. Oily. 050214

Bottle @ Christers. Pours black with a creamy brown head, lacings, some small floaties. Aroma of roasted malt, yeast, little coffee, rich fruity hops. Flavor is roast malt, yeast, coffee, licorice, fruity hops, peach, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, nice bitter finish. Nice beer, well balanced. 050214

Bottle. Black with big beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, pine and liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, hop, very bitter, pine, little sweet and grapefruit. B-IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Bottle @ home. Pitch black color, very small off-white head. Smell and taste malts, some hops, slightly coffee, dark malts, some roastyness. Ok, clearly its a stout, but a little sweeter than I expected. Maybe a little bit thinner texture wise as well. Still, definitely worth to try.

Draught at Porterfestivalen 2013. 
Black with a huge head.
Aroma: roasted, fruity, toffee, hoppy with citrus. 
Taste: fruity with berries like raspberry and blackberry, chocolate, roasted, grapefruit and some pine. 
Medium-bodied. 
Nice.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2016 Keg at The Hanging Bat and Andrew Ushers. Black body with a medium tan head that slowly fades. No lacing. Rich aroma - prunes, plum and raisins, underpinned by coffee and chocolate. Flavour of dark fruits, plain chocolate, black pepper crackers and a nice hoppy lift on the finish. Medium body with a smooth, slick mouthfeel. Light fizz. Dry, dark and bitter. A gem.

BB 05/14. Bottle from Alesbymail. Pours black with a creamy lasting head and lacings. Roast, dark fruit, licorice - quite salty. Some piney hops beneath - which no longer are overly fresh. Smooth and full bodied. Quite bitter finish.

On tap at the Small Bar, Bristol 21/12/2013. Near black with a slight, off-white head. Arma of dark fruits, plan chocolate and roasted malts, with a touch of citrus hop. Flavour was similar with a toasty finish. Very good.
Keykeg Pigs Ear 2013. Dont know hiw to describe it but its good. Thick heavy aroma. Good chocolate roasted malt. Excellent beer black currant fruit. Beer of the day so far.

Pours black with a large tan head.
Nose shows heavy roasted malt with some cocoa notes amongst lots of spicy hops and some resinous piny notes. Very American-styled.
Pretty similar falvours, big roasted malt notes, quite dry. Lots of pine and grapefruit along with an aggressive bitterness.
Carbonation is too full-on.
33cl, no mention of ABV, new exclusive English brew Anno 2012, from Ales By Mail (UK), complex Stout, roasted/malty and slightly spicy/fruity, very balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew

Black with light tan head. Aroma is worceister sauce, dark malt. Taste is mild smoke, dark malt with a medium mouthfeel - feels bigger than 7.5%. Overall, a great beer. One of the best stouts currently coming out of the UK.

(Bottle): Pours black with a big mocha head. Aroma of roasted malt, liquorice, slight saltiness and surprisingly a lot of hops. The hops carried through to the taste but was fought back with huge roasted malt, coffee, liquorice, dark fruit and burnt notes. Really surprising stout, incredibly drinkable too.

Bottle: Intensive aroma of dark berries, plums, cacao powder, dark chocolate, some alcohol. Flavor is malty, alcoholic, notes of dark berries, cacao powder, dark chocolate, rum plums, coffee and roasted malt bitterness. Quite dry, roasty finish. Very good.

Thanks to bobinlondon! Pours an opaque black/brown with a tight tan head. The smell is roasted dark malt, licorice and hops fighting to get through. The taste is hoppy, bitter, roasty, licorice - lots going on. Sweetness balanced out well as it ends dry and roasty. Carbonation is very well done and the body is medium. A great well balanced export stout!
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark coca cola pour with tiny tan head, rich chocolate aroma, taste is dark chocolate, roasted malts, sweet, with a piney hop finish, excellent.

Bottle, BBE 19/04/14. Pours a dark brown, almost black with a good-sized, mocha-colored head. Classy. Aroma is roasty with a lot of chocolate, mocha, cacao. Taste is a lot drier. Very roasty with quite a lot of coffee. Some chocolate, a bit wooden finish. Fairly light.

Black with a huge light brown head. Aroma of toasted, caramel malt, some smoke, really big floral hops. Light sweet, with a medium duration and light bitter finish. Thick oily texture, full body, smooth, with light carbonation. Really tasty.

Very dark brown color, dark brown head. Lovely dry nose with salty licorice, dark fruit and tobacco leaves. Just a slight hint of smokiness, lots of salty licorice, dark chocolate, dark fruit, fairly aggressive hoppiness. Excellent balance. Drinks really big for the strength. Big bitter, dark chocolate, dark fruit finish. Fantastic. Warming.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 Bottle at Chriso?s Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. Earthy roast, big berry with slight tartness. Flavour has big smooth roast. Really solid tasty beer.

Keg at the brewery, lovely looking opaque black coloured pour with a lasting creamy mid tan head. Aroma is smooth Roasty, woodland Berry, dark choc and tangy fruit. Flavour is smooth roast woody, earthy woodland berry, so smooth for the abv. Really well made. Lingering tangy dark fruit and dark choc. So good.
Bottle @ home. Nice simply label. Strong and fine aroma. Appearance was spongy and pretty, but vanished too soon. Little bit burned dry coffee in taste and palate. Overall very enjoyable stout.
Black pour with tan head and lace. Aroma is roasted malt and burnt coffee. Chocolate, burnt coffee, and a good malt bitter. Full bodied with good carbonation. a real nice beer
Bottle, pours nice and dark as a porter/stout should be. Sweet up front all chocolate, saltana and cherriesupfront. This beer has legs a bitter finish which just keeps on going, a wonderful beer.
330 ml bottle. Pours black with a small head. Silky chocolate orange aroma, hints of coffee, velvety palate, very smooth indeed. Really good stout.

4th February 2013Opaque black - brown beer with a good pale tan head. Palate is airy and soft with mild superfine carbonation. Smooth creamy dark malt, very creamy. Very mild roast. Trace of sweet coffee. Pretty luxuriant malt! Mild and fresh orangey hops are seamlessly blended. Traces of tropical fruits and pine in the smooth creamy finish. Slight dark malt linger. Smooth and sophisticated and delicious.

Keg at Hanging Bat. Pours jet black with good tan head. Nose is roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Some red fruit. More roasted bitterness in the taste, and dark sugar sweetness. Finishes big and bold. Very nice.

Bottle at Pleased to Meet You, Newcastle on 30 July 2013.
Poured an oily black with a dense, large light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate and dried fruit. Smooth, thick mouth feel. Flavours of burnt grain, molasses, and citrus hops. Lingering coffee and hop resin bitterness. Very nice.

bottle black pour with thick tan lingering lacing head aromas of dark chocolate , coffee , toasted malt rich taste - chocolate present , some coffee , roasted malts and hop bitterness thick mouthfeel full carbonation some alcohol warmth lasting through decent

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013, 10/08/13. 
Mid black with a good sized tan head.
Nose is roast malts, earthy, bitter chocolate.
Taste comprises rich chocolate tones, mineral notes, earthy, light roast.
Medium bodied with bitem fine carbonation, dry finish.
Good stuff!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours quite big with a small head - looks like an impy to me. Smells like a black IPA -- piney hops reminiscent of Sierra Nevada Narwhal and Emelisse Sorachi Ace Imperial Stout (which is a bad sign...I wasnt fond of either). Body is quite big and only slightly foamy. Taste - Roasted barley, vegetable water, hop astringency. Best feature of this beer is its ashy aftertaste. Its better than the beers I mentioned earlier, but Im really not a fan of this hoppy impy style. Doesnt work for me.
Bottle from AlesByMail.co.uk. Huge creamy head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, coffee, licorice and hops. Nice and bitter. Full bodied.

33 cl bottle @ Utsjoki. Batch #63, BBE 01.12.2013
Lots of foam when pouring. Aroma has hops, coffee notes and some ash  feels like a well hopped brown ale. Flavour has somewhat salty licorice, coffee, ashy notes, gooseberry bush ‐like hops and hints of herbs. Delicious.

Large tan head dark pour medium carbonation the aromas malt chocolate coffee roasted taste vanilla the flavours roast coffee vanilla malted chocolate medium bitter nice smooth caramel the finish rich stout coffee richness malt sweetness medium bitter nice sweet finish good stout

Black with a large tan head. Aroma of mocha, tar, berries, oranges, licorice, pine. Oily, but carbonation is a little high. Roasty with mocha and berries, pine and bitter orange, some tropical fruit like lychees. Bitter finish with some salt. Reminds me a fair bit of Kooinda Black IPA.
Bottled. Black color tan head. roasted coffee, espresso aroma. Flavor similar, roasted coffee. Quite smooth. Oily.

Bottle 33 CL. @ pre Tuska. Pours dark as coal with small lacing head and scent of espresso a,d dark chocolate. Layers of excellent taste. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, roasted malts, alcohol very well hidden behind the great taste. Great.

33cl bottle @ pre tuska festival tasting. Bb 16.07/13. Batch #14? Pitch black, espresso head. Roasty, milky sweet aroma, dark chocolate, very inviting. Flavor has roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, ash and licorice. Loong bitter finish with licorice and chocolate. Excellent.

Bottle at home from ales by mail
Dark cola brown with espresso crema orange Brown head. Rich roast barley, sweet blueberry and cherry chocolate. Very full bodied, rich roast barley, chocolate malt, slight chalky barley, black forest fruit, fruity coffee, proper desert beer. Long rich toasty finish.

Bottle from Dunnottar Wines, Stonehaven. It pours black with a thick tan head. The nose is roasted malt, toast, pine, blueberry, jam, cocoa and salted caramel. The taste is roasted malt, toast, pine, resin, liquorice, burnt earth, dark fruit/berry, jam, ash, decent bitterness and warming alcohol with a dry, roasty finish. Full body and fine carbonation. Good depth of flavour, well balanced and damn tasty. Bravo!
Bottle. Black beer with a nice tanned head. Malty, coffee, licorice and dark chocolate aroma. Coffee, dark chocolate, licorice flavour, smooth and sweetish - a nice one :-)

Bottle from City Beverage Company Shoreditch. Pours black with a big, lightly tanned head which sticks around leaving great lacing. Very roasty and cocoa driven nose. Light espresso coming through. Taste is heavy roast and a half and half combo of coffee and chocolate. Very mocha like. Dry on the palate. Some spritzy carbonation. Not bad. Very good for the style

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 Very strong tasting - sugar, chocolate, hops, treacle, coffee, its all in there. Almost like a black IPA, with a thick rich stout finish. Some excellent juicy green notes under the black. An excellent sipper. Medium carbonation and mouth-feel.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, bread and hops. Flavour of strong roasted malts, salty licorice, chocolate cake, bread and hops. Medium bodied, oily mouthfeel and a roasty, chocolate, salty finish. Great stuff.

330ml bottle. Quasi black colour with average, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Fruity hoppy aroma, notes of grapefruit, passionfruit, some citrus, hints of orange, underlying chocolately dark malty notes. Taste is minimally to moderately sweet dark malty, dark chocolate, fruity hoppy overtones, some orange. Moderately sticky palate, fairly lasting finish.

33 cl bottle. BBE 16.07.2013.
Pours dark brown color with a large, frothy beige head. Aroma is quite dry and ashy with some milky chocolate, roasted malts and dark fruits, some faint honey notes too. Velvety palate with a dark roasted malty flavor, dark chocolate, some cocoa powder and caramel. Mild coffee on the background too. Full-bodied with a long somewhat burnt, chocolaty finish. Very good.
UPDATED: OCT 21, 2015 On tap @ Haket. Dark brown with a small brown head. Roasted with fruity tones. Malt, coffee, fruit and bitterness. Medium to full body with a nice bitter finish.

Bottle from Stirchley Wines. I should have bought and tried this ages; but Im useless. It is supremely good. Wowee.Not sure what makes this NOT a Black IPA, but that shows what I know - which is nowt. This has perked me up somewhat cos otherwise am not feeling it tonight. Hey perhaps I can turn into a person who advertises their borderlines depression via Twitter - would that be entertaining? Not sure.

330ml bottle from Ales by Mail
BBE 16.7.2013 - Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma of licorice, roasted malts, dark chocolate and cocoa. Taste is smooth, slightly roasty with notes of salty licorice, cocoa, coffee and hints of dark chocolate. Finish is sweetish, roasty and salty with some licorice and dark chocolate notes. Nice, quite balanced and tasty salty stout.
090313. Bottle at home. Pours black with a nice head. Aroma roasted malts, coffee. Dry oily palate. Full bodied. Not Bad.

You can probably predict where Ill go with this. Here goes...I used to have an old Polo. I called it Keith. It was red and a bit rusty. I bought it from from the sister of my ex. It cost far too much. But I loved it. It was my first car and we went everywhere together. But then I tired of its sluggish ways, lack of a CD player (cassette and radio only), and increasing pinkness. I sold it for £50 to my sister. She sold it for £200 a year later. So I bought a Saab. Safe. Reliable (like feck is it). It has a HWM sticker in the back window. Im saying nothing about the beer, but you know its good.

Bottle 330ml.Clear dark black brown colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, licorice. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, dark malt, roasted, english licorice, chocolate, citrus hops, licorice notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121203]

Cheeky bottle from Stirchley. I say cheeky, I should probably have been on my way to work instead. Still, opportunity knocks and if you buy your boss a bottle of beer while youre there, well, they aint gonna complain now are they? This is very tasty, sweet compared to the chili and other stouts but my buds may be interferred with at the moment (well, it is Valentines day afterall), and cheap. Problem is I finished it before I could thnk about what exactly it tasted like. Ive also stuffed my face with a bag of beef chili jerky from the deli counter at Selfridges. That shit is amazing, you gotta get yourself some. My mouth is humming with chili and stout flavours. What is not to like? 2 beer night did we say? Oh, go on then. Kernel??

Flaske 0,33l fra Kris Wines. Delt med Rune under seanse i H9 17 Jan 13. Ultradyprød. Nesten svart. Høyt mokkafarget skum som varer lenge. Mye kniplingsverk på glasset. Topp utseende. God sjokoladearoma. Smaken er lakris med innslag av sjokolade. Litt søt røstet malt dukker opp med avslutter med en deilig bitter vri. Ypperlig øl!

330ml bottle bought at Kris Wines in London, carried back home and shared with Finn during a rating session at his place. Initially, huge, tan-coloured head blanketing the glassware. Jet black body. Inviting aroma of mocha chocolate, semi-dry. Delightful malt-fruity taste of mid-sweet chocolate and red oranges. Lasting bittersweet ending. Well balanced. Excellent (Tromsø, 17.01.2013).

Bottle from Kris Vines, London. Pitch black beer with a very nice lasting beige head. Chocolate aroma, roasted, hoppy, licorice, tar, caramel, pine, cocoa powder, notes from figs and raisins, coffee notes, creamy, some red grapes. Chocolate flavor, quite roasted, ash, licorice, tar notes, dark chocolate, cocoa powder, hoppy, floral, raisins, pine needles, caramel, some vinous notes. Full bodied and still very drinkable. I really like this...
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. An inky black beer that pours with a large foamy tan head. Rich chocolate, liquorice and citrus flavours with red fruit and slight roast on the finish. Superb!

Draught at Bishop Gustav with my friend Petrus. Pours darkest brown with a small craemy head. Coffee, chocolate, soy and dark fruits on the nose. Velvety and creamy i the mouth, a little sorness like an fruity espresso, dark berries, little bitterness, almost porterlike sweetness, rich and full of taste. Really nice.

Poured very dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of sweet roast malt with a phenolic hint. Medium, smooth oily body, flavour of dark roast malt with some coffee and dark chocolate. Dry, lingering aftertaste.
Tap at bat. Black with tan head. Nice big roasty ashy aroma, almost smokey with a slight fruitiness. Similar taste,  roasty and chocolatey. Thick and sweet. Very nice

330ml bottle, best before 16/07/13. Pours nearly pitch black with a thick and creamy mocha head. Leaves lots of tiny lace on the edges. Aroma has coffee, creamy caramel, bitter hop notes, smooth chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, coffee, a fairly high bitter note from the hops, some ash. A real pleasant tiramisu-like mocha finish. Mouthfeel is slightly sticky and crisp with fairly high carbonation. Pretty complex for having only 7,5% - great stuff.

Bottle at home, 30th November 2012, to finish the evening after a Buxton axe edge and a very tasty Kernel Double Black. This is an excellent stout, pours deep black a fine head, aroma is chocolate, cocoa and coffee, some sweet berry. Taste is very like kernel export stout, good roastiness, lots pog on and perfect balance, spme sweet berry in the finish, mild to medium carbonation, excellent beer

Bottle from Ales by Mail. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a healthy beige head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, dark chocolate, dark fruit. Very well balanced. A quite superb stout from Redchurch.
330ml bottle.  Pours very dark brown with a medium head.  Aroma is piney hops with cocoa underneath.  Taste has grapefruit and coffee throughout with piney hops and cocoa in the finish.

Aroma: Smelling of dark fruits, figs, cold coffee.Appearance: A black and brown beer. A brown head with some lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet dark bread, fig marmalade, cold coffee and crushed seeds.Palate: Low carbonation, a soft and oily texture. A good body with a long dry finish.Overall: In all a good export stout, balanced and powerful.Note: Bottle 330 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2012-11-03.

Bottle from Utobeer. Colour is opaque very dark brown, big foaming tan brown head. Nose is dark chocolate, black coffee, roasted malt, bit of a sweet Sauternes vinous quality coming from the hops. Taste is black coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate. cacao, some grapey vinous fruitiness from the hops. This is very very similar to Kernel Export Stout with a few of its own distinct characteristics. And just as good! Best beer from these guys!!!

(Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival, 29 Oct 2012) Black colour with creamy, beige head. Roasted, malty nose with black coffee, dark chocolate and cacao. Malty, roasted taste with notes of black coffee, cacao, dark chocolate, ashes and a dry finish with a generous cacao bitterness. More than medium body, mainly dry. Excellently balanced and very tasty. Lovely beer!

33 cl bottle at Dahlberg. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is spiced and dark malty. Dense chocolate and light liqourice. Thick roasted malty and liqourice. Bitter, choclate and liqourice. Smooth roasted.
Bottle (Stockholm Beer Festival 2012) - Black with a tan head. Coffee, chocolate and roasted malt in the aroma. Chocolatey taste with liquorice, plain chocolate and roasted malt.
Draught at SBWF.  Dark black, beige creamy head. Huge coffee aroma. Dry and full bodied with rather clean mouthfeel. Heavily roasty with heavy inky bitterness.

330ml bottle.
Pours a dark brown, with a beige head.
Roasted aroma, malt, coffee, caramel, chocolate, licorice.
Off-dry, medium body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Smooth, roasted taste, chocolate, coffee, caramel, tobacco, ashes. (2012-09-27)

Bottle from the legendary Kris Wines. The pours pitch black with a large, thick tan head. Very attractive. The nose is roasted malts, charred wood, plenty of ashy earth. Light spicy floral hop notes and hints of sweet chocolate. The taste is bitter chocolate malts giving over to hints of vinous red grape. Some tart cranberry. Quite woody. Plenty of earthy hop bitterness on the long, bone-dry finish. The bodys very nimble for a 7.5% beer, this drinks very easy indeed. Wonderfully expressive palate. Creamy but clean and dry. Overall, wow, this greatly exceeded my expectations. Pretty much faultless for what it is. With the success of EIPA and now this, Redchurch are a name to watch.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Poured jet black with a thick beige head. Really very black. Initial aroma slightly black ipa-esque, more hop than expected, then more stout earthy roast character. Very complex taste, roasted malt, earthy, tobacco?, hop so still see some black ipa in there, hint of alcohol. Long finish, dry roast and bitter, but also smooth. Very nice.

Bottle at home in London. Pours rich brown with a voluptuous, beige foam head. Aroma smacks of rich dirt, dark cocoa, earth, dark cherries. Medium sweet flavor with intense, gritty dirt, charred malts, burnt cocoa, some baking cocoa, toasted leaves, soil, dry tobacco. Medium to full bodied with fine, smooth carbonation. Fairly dry on the finish with a bit of sticky, burnt sugar, lots of ash, tobacco, char, dirt, deep and dark chocolate, straight baking cocoa, some burnt-to-a-crisp toast, burnt sugars. Wow, what a beer. Incredibly dynamic. Plenty of burnt, bitter grass and earth in the aftertaste. The ABV affords the beer a wonderful level of depth and complexity without any boozy sting. Very, very good beer. World-class stuff, in fact.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2013 Gusher ... i lost over half the bottle :-( ... dark black ... thick gritty sediment settling in glass ... big tan head (massive) even when i poured the gusher it just rose up out of glass every where ... gritty residure round glass ...deep dark coffee roast ... sweet roast ... some chocolate ... sweet roast ... little meaty ...gritty mouth feel... This could have been so much better... need to retry a non gusher 2.5


keeg at the bat ... deep black ... big bubbly brown head ... to cold even to pick up ... soft dark chocolate ... soft roast malt nose ... soapy bitter chocolate roast ... quite piney ... definite over fizzy ... chocolate and long soapy pine linger 3.5
